title: Use “Binary Finary 1999” as the Play-button background music track

requirements.text: Replace the bundled background music audio that plays when the user presses the floating Play button with the track requested by the user (“Binary Finary 1999”), while keeping the existing audio URL/path used by the app unchanged ("/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3").

quotes: Binary finary 1999 musik auf den Playbutton hinzufügen

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the floating Play button starts playback of the updated track.
The code continues to reference the exact same audio path: "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3" (no path changes).
Existing background music behavior remains intact: no autoplay on first visit unless previously opted-in, and the controller still switches from Play to mute/volume controls when playing.
If the audio file cannot be loaded/played, the existing English error message behavior remains visible and the Play button remains available for retry.

requirements.text: Ensure the updated bundled audio asset is included as a static frontend asset at the existing location used by the app ("/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3"), without introducing additional audio files/paths for playback.

quotes: Binary finary 1999 musik auf den Playbutton hinzufügen

acceptanceCriteria: The built frontend includes the audio file at the same location that resolves for the browser as "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3".
No other code changes are required to select the new track (the existing Play button flow continues to work).

constraints: Do not change the existing audio path string "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3" used in the codebase.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Adding a pause/stop button or changing the music controller UI/UX beyond what is required to swap the track.
Changing autoplay/opt-in, mute, or volume persistence behavior.
